column1: Exciting dynamic drama is happening in Tameside Schools through the Youth Services Theatre-in-Education Project.
Young People Centre, Duke Street, Denton  0161 336 6615
The principle aim of the TIE initiative is to equip young people with the skills to create their own issue based drama within the school environment.

Young people with a love of performing arts are encouraged to partake in high profile drama programmes, which result in producing  hard hitting, factual plays created by young people for young people.
The young people included in the project become actively involved in research, group discussions, improvisations, devising, scripting and performance.
In some instances the theatrical presentations have formed part of the pupil's GCSE Drama, whilst others have developed into full-scale community productions.

"Working alongside another drama specialist has proved to be an invaluable experience for myself whilst students found the exploration of issue based work to be thought provoking, moving and edifying."
Ann McMinn, Drama CoOrdinator, Stamford High School

"My own observations and the feedback I have received from the pupils indicate that they have all responded very positively to the work, being fully engaged and committed throughout.  Their performance skills have benefited from this additional venture, as indeed has their understanding of the pressures that surround young people today."
Jane Ferguson, Head of Drama, Longdendale High School

"The group of young people involved in the project have been actively involved in Internet research, group discussion and interview technique.  This enabled them to collate evidence to improvise scenarios and prepare a final script, which they feel they have ownership of.  A terrific Scheme!"
Carol E Evans, Head of Drama, Alder High School
"I loved every minute of the work - it made me more confident particularly when I had to interview people."
"Great!  The group really got to know one another and became very close."
"Being part of the group made me realise that I wasn't the only person in the world who had worries."
"Everyone took the drama seriously and we were able to put the play on for yr.9's, they kept coming up to us after saying how good it was."
"It has made me want to study drama and join a professional TIE Company."
